org.apache.spark.sql.vectorized

Class ColumnarBatch

  • Object
    • org.apache.spark.sql.vectorized.ColumnarBatch

  • @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public final class ColumnarBatch
extends Object
    This class wraps multiple ColumnVectors as a row-wise table. It provides a row view of this batch so that Spark can access the data row by row. Instance of it is meant to be reused during the entire data loading process.

      ColumnarBatch(ColumnVector[] columns)

      Returns the number of columns that make up this batch.
      int numRows()
      Returns the number of rows for read, including filtered rows.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColumnarBatch

        public ColumnarBatch(ColumnVector[] columns)

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Called to close all the columns in this batch. It is not valid to access the data after calling this. This must be called at the end to clean up memory allocations.

      • rowIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.InternalRow> rowIterator()
        Returns an iterator over the rows in this batch.

      • setNumRows

        public void setNumRows(int numRows)
        Sets the number of rows in this batch.

      • numCols

        public int numCols()
        Returns the number of columns that make up this batch.

      • numRows

        public int numRows()
        Returns the number of rows for read, including filtered rows.

      • column

        public ColumnVector column(int ordinal)
        Returns the column at `ordinal`.

      • getRow

        public org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst.InternalRow getRow(int rowId)
        Returns the row in this batch at `rowId`. Returned row is reused across calls.
